alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 4:10AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Snow Showers for Western to Central Nevada Saturday... * Lake effect snow is occurring early this morning east of Lake Tahoe and Pyramid Lake. Interstate 580 and Highway 395 between Minden and Washoe Valley may have slick and snow-covered roads this morning. If the lake effect bands persist, snow amounts over 3 inches may result for areas just east of Pyramid Lake and Lake Tahoe. * Snow showers are expected to develop across western Nevada from late morning into the evening. Light, unpaved surface snowfall accumulations are possible; however, most areas of western Nevada will see little to no travel impacts other than wet roads. * The exception for impactful snow accumulations is across eastern Pershing and Churchill counties where more persistent snow is possible this afternoon and evening. The most likely scenario is for up to 2 inches of snow, including for I-80 north of Lovelock and Highway 50 east of Fallon. However, some scenarios are showing up to 4 inches along Highway 50 in extreme eastern Churchill County. Be sure to check the latest road conditions from NDOT before traveling in eastern Pershing and Churchill counties today.
